metadata.title: CVE-2020-16119 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel exploitable by a localattacker due to reuse of a DCCP socket with an attached dccps_hc_tx_ccidobject as a listener after being released. Fixed in Ubuntu Linux kernel5.4.0-51.56, 5.3.0-68.63, 4.15.0-121.123, 4.4.0-193.224, 3.13.0.182.191 and3.2.0-149.196.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-16119` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1141-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1141.151
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1145-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1145.155
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
linux-hwe package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
linux-kvm package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
linux-azure package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
linux-oracle package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1141.151').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1145.155').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
